duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide technical support, subject matter expertise, and training to warehouse associates on proper warehouse management system (WMS) usage and warehouse procedures.
Assist warehouse associates in resolving system, equipment, or procedures-related issues as they occur.
Inspect product for damage, quality, or deterioration of packing and resolve related issues.
Create and manage return authorization transactions for returned and refused products.
Complete end of day procedures, day end menu, and UPS data transmission.
Operate material handling equipment (MHE) in a safe and orderly manner, ensuring it is maintained and reporting repair or service needs.
Ensure warehouse computers and radio frequency (RF) equipment are used in a safe and professional manner.
Comply with company policies, State/Federal laws, and safety regulations, and support food safety policies and programs.
Report any unfixable/unsafe issues and observe and enforce all safety rules to eliminate accidents and injuries.
Comply with applicable State/Federal laws, regulations, and policies.
Support and perform other warehouse duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: High School diploma or General Education Degree (GED) preferred.
